prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories:
A three-year-old girl remains in a coma after nearly drowning in a wave pool at a popular water park on Saturday.

A 32-year-old man has been arrested on suspicion of child endangerment after allegedly leaving the toddler unattended in the pool area.

The incident occurred at Splash World Water Park in Anaheim, California, around 3:45pm local time, according to authorities.

The child was pulled from the pool by a bystander and received CPR before being rushed to the hospital, where she remains in critical condition.

A witness described the scene as "chaotic" and said the child's parents were nowhere to be found when the incident occurred.

The arrested man, identified as the child's uncle, was released on bail pending further investigation.

Detective James Smith of the Anaheim Police Department urged anyone who witnessed the incident to come forward, saying "We need to piece together what happened in those crucial minutes to determine how this tragedy occurred."

Splash World Water Park issued a statement saying they were "deeply saddened" by the incident and were cooperating fully with the authorities.

The investigation is ongoing, and authorities are reviewing security footage to determine the circumstances leading up to the near-drowning.

A five-year-old boy clings to life after a tragic accident at a crowded amusement park on Sunday.

A 28-year-old woman has been taken into custody on suspicion of reckless endangerment after allegedly allowing the child to ride a rollercoaster without proper supervision.

The incident occurred at Thrill Valley Amusement Park in Orlando, Florida, around 2:15pm local time, according to authorities.

The child was thrown from the ride and landed on the pavement, suffering severe head injuries. Bystanders rushed to his aid and called for emergency services, which transported him to the hospital where he remains in a medically induced coma.

A witness described the scene as "horrific" and said the child's parents were distracted by their phones when the incident occurred.

The arrested woman, identified as the child's babysitter, was released on bail pending further investigation.

Detective Emily Johnson of the Orlando Police Department urged anyone who witnessed the incident to come forward, saying "We need to understand what led to this devastating event to ensure it never happens again."

Thrill Valley Amusement Park issued a statement saying they were "shaken" by the incident and were cooperating fully with the authorities.

The investigation is ongoing, and authorities are reviewing security footage to determine the circumstances leading up to the accident.

A young girl fights for her life after a near-drowning incident at a packed waterpark on a sweltering summer day.

A 35-year-old man has been arrested on suspicion of negligence after allegedly leaving the child unattended in the wave pool.

The incident occurred at Splash Island Waterpark in San Diego, California, around 3:45pm local time, according to authorities.

The child was pulled from the water unconscious and not breathing, suffering from severe oxygen deprivation. Lifeguards and bystanders rushed to her aid, performing CPR until paramedics arrived and transported her to the hospital where she remains in critical condition.

A witness described the scene as "chaotic" and said the man was too engrossed in his own swimming to notice the child's struggle.

The arrested man, identified as the child's uncle, was released on bail pending further investigation.

Lieutenant Michael Rodriguez of the San Diego Police Department urged anyone who witnessed the incident to come forward, saying "We need to piece together what happened to prevent such a tragedy from occurring again."

Splash Island Waterpark issued a statement saying they were "deeply saddened" by the incident and were fully cooperating with the authorities.

The investigation is ongoing, and authorities are reviewing security footage to determine the circumstances leading up to the accident.

A lone hiker clings to life after a devastating rockslide at a popular canyon trail on a stormy autumn morning.

A 28-year-old guide has been questioned on suspicion of reckless endangerment after allegedly ignoring warning signs and leading the trek despite treacherous conditions.

The incident occurred at Red Rock Canyon in Colorado, around 10:15am local time, according to park rangers.

The hiker was buried under debris and pinned by a massive boulder, suffering from severe internal injuries. Fellow hikers and rescue teams rushed to the scene, working tirelessly to free the victim and transport them to the hospital where they remain in critical condition.

A witness described the scene as "apocalyptic" and said the guide was too focused on reaching the summit to heed the warnings of impending danger.

The guide, identified as an experienced climber, was released pending further investigation.

Ranger Emily Patel of the Colorado Parks Department urged anyone who witnessed the incident to come forward, saying "We need to understand what led to this disaster to prevent such a tragedy from happening again."

Red Rock Canyon issued a statement saying they were "shaken" by the incident and were fully cooperating with the authorities.

The investigation is ongoing, and authorities are reviewing weather reports and eyewitness accounts to determine the circumstances leading up to the accident.

A seasoned sailor clings to the wreckage after a catastrophic storm ravages a popular island route on a dark winter night.

A 35-year-old captain has been detained on suspicion of negligence after allegedly ignoring distress signals and navigating the treacherous waters despite hurricane-force winds.

The incident occurred near the rocky shores of Stormy Isle, around 11:45pm local time, according to coast guard reports.

The sailor was left stranded, battered by the raging sea and pinned by the splintered mast, suffering from severe hypothermia. Fellow sailors and rescue teams battled against the elements to retrieve the victim and transport them to the hospital where they remain in critical condition.

A witness described the scene as "chaotic" and said the captain was too confident in their vessel to heed the warnings of impending doom.

The captain, identified as a veteran of the seas, was released pending further investigation.

Coast Guard Commander James Reed urged anyone who witnessed the incident to come forward, saying "We need to understand what led to this disaster to prevent such a tragedy from happening again."

Stormy Isle Marina issued a statement saying they were "devastated" by the incident and were fully cooperating with the authorities.

The investigation is ongoing, and authorities are reviewing weather reports and eyewitness accounts to determine the circumstances leading up to the accident.

A lone mountaineer clings to the icy cliff face after a devastating avalanche sweeps away a popular trekking route on a blindingly bright summer day.

A 40-year-old guide has been arrested on suspicion of recklessness after allegedly disregarding warnings of unstable snow conditions and leading the group into the treacherous terrain despite clear signs of danger.

The incident occurred near the snow-capped peaks of Glacier Ridge, around 2:15pm local time, according to park ranger reports.

The mountaineer was left dangling, battered by the falling rocks and pinned by the twisted metal of their climbing gear, suffering from severe internal injuries. Fellow trekkers and rescue teams battled against the harsh conditions to retrieve the victim and transport them to the hospital where they remain in a coma.

A witness described the scene as "surreal" and said the guide was too arrogant in their abilities to heed the warnings of impending disaster.

The guide, identified as a seasoned expert, was released on bail pending further investigation.

Park Ranger Director Emily Patel urged anyone who witnessed the incident to come forward, saying "We need to understand what led to this catastrophe to prevent such a tragedy from happening again."

Glacier Ridge Expeditions issued a statement saying they were "heartbroken" by the incident and were fully cooperating with the authorities.

The investigation is ongoing, and authorities are reviewing weather reports and eyewitness accounts to determine the circumstances leading up to the accident.

A solitary sailor clung to the shattered mast of their yacht after a ferocious storm ravaged the popular sailing route on a dark and foreboding winter night.

A 35-year-old captain has been detained on suspicion of negligence after allegedly ignoring warnings of a low-pressure system and steering the vessel into the turbulent waters despite clear signs of danger.

The incident occurred near the rocky shores of Stormy Cove, around 10:45pm local time, according to coast guard reports.

The sailor was left stranded, battered by the crashing waves and pinned by the tangled rigging of their yacht, suffering from severe hypothermia and a broken leg. Fellow sailors and rescue teams battled against the treacherous conditions to retrieve the victim and transport them to the hospital where they remain in critical condition.

A witness described the scene as "apocalyptic" and said the captain was too confident in their abilities to heed the warnings of impending disaster.

The captain, identified as a seasoned navigator, was released on bail pending further investigation.

Coast Guard Director James Reed urged anyone who witnessed the incident to come forward, saying "We need to understand what led to this tragedy to prevent such a disaster from happening again."

Stormy Cove Sailing Co. issued a statement saying they were "devastated" by the incident and were fully cooperating with the authorities.

The investigation is ongoing, and authorities are reviewing weather reports and eyewitness accounts to determine the circumstances leading up to the accident.

A lone climber clung to the icy slope of Mount Raven's Peak, her ropes tangled and her crampons bent, after a brutal avalanche swept away her entire expedition on a blindingly bright and unforgiving summer morning.

A 40-year-old guide has been taken into custody on suspicion of recklessness after allegedly disregarding warnings of unstable snow conditions and leading the group into the treacherous terrain despite clear signs of danger.

The incident occurred near the snow-encased cliffs of Glacier's Edge, around 9:15am local time, according to park ranger reports.

The climber was left stranded, battered by the howling winds and pinned by the weight of her pack, suffering from severe frostbite and a punctured lung. Fellow climbers and rescue teams battled against the treacherous conditions to retrieve the victim and transport her to the hospital where she remains in critical condition.

A witness described the scene as "surreal" and said the guide was too arrogant in their abilities to heed the warnings of impending disaster.

The investigation is ongoing, and authorities are reviewing weather reports and eyewitness accounts to determine the circumstances leading up to the accident.

A lone sailor clung to the shattered mast of her storm-battered yacht, her sails torn and her hull breached, after a catastrophic hurricane ravaged her entire crew on a dark and foreboding autumn night.

A 35-year-old captain has been arrested on suspicion of negligence after allegedly ignoring warnings of severe weather conditions and leading the vessel into the treacherous waters despite clear signs of danger.

The incident occurred near the rocky shores of Cape Wrath, around 11:45pm local time, according to coast guard reports.

The sailor was left adrift, pounded by the towering waves and pinned by the weight of the wreckage, suffering from severe hypothermia and a broken collarbone. Fellow sailors and rescue teams battled against the raging storm to retrieve the victim and transport her to the hospital where she remains in critical condition.

A witness described the scene as "apocalyptic" and said the captain was too blinded by their ego to heed the warnings of impending doom.

A 40-year-old guide has been accused of reckless endangerment after allegedly ignoring warnings of unstable snow conditions and leading the group into the treacherous terrain despite clear signs of danger.

A 40-year-old guide has been accused of reckless endangerment after allegedly disregarding warnings of treacherous slope conditions and leading the group into the heart of the avalanche zone despite clear signs of danger.

In the frozen vastness of the Arctic Circle, a lone explorer stumbled through the wreckage of her research station, her distress signal swallowed by the howling blizzard that had ravaged her entire team on the unforgiving ice.

A 40-year-old scientist has been accused of reckless endangerment after allegedly ignoring warnings of a catastrophic polar vortex and leading the expedition into the path of the deadly storm, despite clear signs of danger flashing on the satellite feeds.

The disaster occurred in the desolate expanse of the frozen tundra, around 3am local time, according to Rescue Team reports.

The explorer was left stranded, battered by the biting winds and blinded by the stinging snow, suffering from severe frostbite and a severe concussion. Fellow researchers and rescue teams battled against the raging blizzard to retrieve the survivor and transport her to the medical camp where she remains in critical condition.
